intro: Geraniospermum velutinum, commonly known as the velvet geranium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, typically during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
